009package imagingbook.common.geometry.circle;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
014
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * Represents an algebraic circle with four parameters A, B, C, D in the form A
022 * * (x^2 + y^2) + B * x + C * y + D = 0. Parameters are normalized such that
023 * B^2 + C^2 - 4 * A * D = 1 and A &ge; 0 Circle instances are immutable. See
024 * Sec. 11.1.1 and Appendix F.2.1 of [1] for details.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/11/17
033 */
034public class AlgebraicCircle {
035
036        /**
037         * Circle parameter.
038         */
039        public final double A, B, C, D;
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance
043         * whose parameters A, B, C, D are normalized such that
044         * B^2 + C^2 - 4 * A * D = 1 and A &ge; 0.
045         * Throws an exception if d = B^2 + C^2 - 4 * A * D (the <em>discriminant</em>) is negative.
046         * 
047         * @param A circle parameter A
048         * @param B circle parameter B
049         * @param C circle parameter C
050         * @param D circle parameter D
051         */
052        public AlgebraicCircle(double A, double B, double C, double D) {
053                // discriminant (d) must be positive!
054                double d = sqr(B) + sqr(C) - 4 * A * D;
055                if (isZero(A) || d < Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE) {
056                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal circle parameters (zero A or non-positive discriminant)");
057                }
058                // normalize parameters to (B^2 + C^2 - 4 * A * D) = 1 and A >= 0
059                double s = 1 / sqrt(d);
060                if (A >= 0) {
061                        this.A = A * s;
062                        this.B = B * s;
063                        this.C = C * s;
064                        this.D = D * s;
065                }
066                else {
067                        this.A = -A * s;
068                        this.B = -B * s;
069                        this.C = -C * s;
070                        this.D = -D * s;
071                }
072        }
073        
074        /**
075         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance from the
076         * specified parameter vector [A, B, C, D].
077         * 
078         * @param p algebraic circle parameters
079         */
080        public AlgebraicCircle(double[] p) {
081                this(p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3]);
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance from
086         * a {@link GeometricCircle}.
087         * 
088         * @param gc a {@link GeometricCircle}
089         */
090        public AlgebraicCircle(GeometricCircle gc) {
091                this(getAlgebraicCircleParameters(gc));
092        }
093
094        private static double[] getAlgebraicCircleParameters(GeometricCircle gc) {
095                double A = 1 / (2 * gc.r);
096                double B = -2 * A * gc.xc;
097                double C = -2 * A * gc.yc;
098                double D = (sqr(B) + sqr(C) - 1) / (4 * A);
099                return new double[] {A, B, C, D};
100        }
101        
102        /**
103         * Returns a vector of algebraic circle parameters (A, B, C, D).
104         * 
105         * @return algebraic circle parameters (A, B, C, D)
106         */
107        public double[] getParameters() {
108                return new double[] {A, B, C, D};
109        }
110        
111        @Override
112        public boolean equals(Object other) {
113                if (this == other) {
114                        return true;
115                }
116                if (!(other instanceof AlgebraicCircle)) {
117            return false;
118        }
119                return this.equals((AlgebraicCircle) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * Same as {@link #equals(Object)} but with a numeric tolerance on parameters.
124         * @param other some other circle
125         * @param tolerance numeric tolerance
126         * @return true is equal
127         */
128        public boolean equals(AlgebraicCircle other, double tolerance) {
129                return 
130                                Arithmetic.equals(A, other.A, tolerance) &&
131                                Arithmetic.equals(B, other.B, tolerance) &&
132                                Arithmetic.equals(C, other.C, tolerance) &&
133                                Arithmetic.equals(D, other.D, tolerance) ;
134        }
135        
136        /**
137         * Returns a copy of this circle.
138         * @return a copy of this circle
139         */
140        public AlgebraicCircle duplicate() {
141                return new AlgebraicCircle(this.getParameters());
142        }
143        
144        
145        @Override
146        public String toString() {
147                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s [A=%f, B=%f, C=%f, D=%f]", 
148                                AlgebraicCircle.class.getSimpleName(), A, B, C, D);
149        }
150        
151}
